required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Coherence Imaging of the Cervical Epithelium
clinical_study.official_title: Coherence Imaging of the Cervical Epithelium

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop a multiplexed low coherence interferometry (mLCI) endoscopic probe for mapping the epithelial types of the cervix. This vaginal mLCI probe will obtain optical measurements from the cervix. These measurements can be used to create a map of the surface cells that distinguishes ectocervical epithelia, endocervical epithelia, and the squamocolumnar junction (t-zone), which is the region where cervical dysplasia is most likely to occur.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Interferometric Data Acquired From Cervical Epithelium
primary_outcome.description: measured by: ability to receive interferometric data from at least one portion of the cervical epithelium

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Automated Classification of Cervical Epithelium
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients for which an interferometric tissue classification was made using optical mLCI data

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Frequency of Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of adverse events experienced by patients during the mLCI study.

intervention.description: imaging of cervical epithelium using mLCI device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- able to provide informed consent
- willing to abstain from sexual intercourse for at least 24 hours before study visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant
- using an intrauterine device (IUD)
- have a current gynecological infection or discharge
- have had any cervical surgery
- had medical or cosmetic surgery involving the reproductive organs or genitals within the past 6 months
- currently enrolled in any research studies involving the application of vaginal formulations
- employed or supervised by the study investigators
- have any other condition, that, in the opinion of the study clinician, would contraindicate participation in the study

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: mLCI Imaging (Pilot)
group.description: Pilot study. 5 women from ages 24 to 34 recruited at Duke University (Durham, NC). Exclusion criteria included history of cervical dysplasia or previous surgery on the cervix, complaint of vaginal discharge or suspicion of sexually transmitted infection at the time of presentation, or positive urine pregnancy test.

group.title: mLCI Imaging (Jacobi)
group.description: Primary arm of present study. 50 women from ages 18 to 42 recruited from routine care population at New York City Health + Hospitals / Jacobi (Bronx, New York, NY). Exclusion criteria included history of cervical dysplasia or previous surgery on the cervix, complaint of vaginal discharge or suspicion of sexually transmitted infection at the time of presentation, or positive urine pregnancy test. Women were examined by speculum to visualize the cervix. Wallach colposcope was used to acquire a photograph of the cervix. mLCI probe was then inserted through speculum and placed against the cervix by endoscopic visual guidance provided through the probe. Optical interferometric data was acquired within a 20 mm field of view, and results were analyzed to determine tissue type.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Interferometric Data Acquired From Cervical Epithelium
measure.description: measured by: ability to receive interferometric data from at least one portion of the cervical epithelium

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Automated Classification of Cervical Epithelium
outcome.description: The number of patients for which an interferometric tissue classification was made using optical mLCI data
outcome.population: Patients from whom epithelial interferometric data were successfully captured and for whom a corresponding colposcope image could be registered. No pilot study patients were included as no colposcopic examination was conducted in the pilot phase.

group.title: mLCI Imaging (Pilot)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
